title: 114_hr2745
content: The Act is titled the "Standard Merger and Acquisition Reviews Through Equal Rules Act of 2015." It amends the Clayton Act by introducing a new section 4F regarding actions by the Attorney General of the United States or the Federal Trade Commission. The Act, titled the "Standard Merger and Acquisition Reviews Through Equal Rules Act of 2015," introduces a new section 4F regarding actions by the Attorney General of the United States or the Federal Trade Commission under the antitrust laws or section 7. If the Attorney General or Federal Trade Commission believes a State attorney general could bring a similar action under this Act, they must notify the State attorney general and provide assistance upon request. The Act allows the State attorney general access to investigative files relevant to antitrust actions. The Federal Trade Commission is mandated to enforce compliance with section 7. The Federal Trade Commission enforces compliance with section 7 in the same manner as the Attorney General. If the FTC approves an agreement with parties to the transaction containing a consent order for a violation of section 7, it will enforce compliance accordingly. Additionally, amendments are made to sections 13 and 15 regarding the FTC's role in addressing violations of section 7. Amendments are made to the Federal Trade Commission Act, specifically regarding the enforcement of section 7 and the FTC's role in addressing violations. Amendments to the Federal Trade Commission Act include provisions related to the enforcement of section 7 of the Clayton Act, allowing the FTC to address unfair competition in proposed mergers, acquisitions, joint ventures, or similar transactions. The district courts of the United States have jurisdiction to issue writs of mandamus to enforce the provisions of the Act and orders of the commission. Amendments to the Federal Trade Commission Act include provisions related to the enforcement of section 7 of the Clayton Act in mergers, acquisitions, joint ventures, or similar transactions. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE; APPLICATION OF AMENDMENTS. This Act and its amendments will take effect upon enactment, with exceptions for violations of the Clayton Act, transactions complying with section 7A, and cases with preliminary injunctions.
